London Assembly Members - facts and contact information

There are 25 members of the London Assembly who are elected at the same time as the Mayor. Fourteen constituency members represent an area of London (each constituency is made up of two or three complete London boroughs). Eleven members are elected on a Londonwide basis.

Constituency members

Constituency Member Party
Barnet & Camden Brian Coleman Conservative
Bexley & Bromley James Cleverly Conservative
Brent & Harrow Navin Shah Labour
City & East (Barking & Dagenham, City of London, Newham and Tower Hamlets) John Biggs Labour
Croydon & Sutton Steve O'Connell Conservative
Ealing & Hillingdon Richard Barnes Conservative
Enfield & Haringey Joanne McCartney Labour
Greenwich & Lewisham Len Duvall Labour
Havering & Redbridge Roger Evans Conservative
Lambeth & Southwark Valerie Shawcross Labour
Merton & Wandsworth Richard Tracey Conservative
North East (Hackney, Islington & Waltham Forest) Jennette Arnold Labour
South West (Hounslow, Kingston-upon-Thames & Richmond-upon-Thames) Tony Arbour Conservative
West Central (Hammersmith & Fulham, Kensington & Chelsea, Westminster) Kit Malthouse Conservative
